intro: Erianthus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered grass, is a perennial grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, pale green or white flowers in panicle inflorescences, which are typically clustered at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Erianthus parviflorus is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its attractive foliage and low maintenance requirements.
